node.title: Women Broke Into Man’s Home and Threw Glitter at Him, Police Say
node.alt: The Clearwater apartment complex where the glitter attack took place.
node.description: Two women face burglary charges for entering the man’s apartment in Clearwater, Fla., the authorities said. The police said they found glitter inside a car belonging to one of the women.
node.content: ["Two women have been charged with felony burglary, accused of breaking into a man\u2019s apartment in Clearwater, Fla., and throwing containers of glitter at him during an argument, the authorities said.", "The man was standing on his balcony when the women, Sarah Franks, 29, and Kaitlin O\u2019Donovan, 27, both of Clearwater, arrived at his apartment complex just before 3 a.m. on Monday, according to the Clearwater Police Department.", "The women began arguing with the man and Ms. Franks threw a container of glitter at him, striking him in the upper torso and head, according to an arrest affidavit. Ms. Franks then climbed over the balcony railing, entered the man\u2019s apartment and threw more containers of glitter at him. She then unlocked the front door of the apartment and let in Ms. O\u2019Donovan, according to the arrest affidavits.", "Once she was inside the apartment, Ms. O\u2019Donovan also began throwing containers of glitter at the man, her arrest affidavit said.", "As she was leaving the apartment, Ms. Franks kicked a window until it broke, according to her arrest affidavit.", "After the women fled the apartment complex, the police found Ms. Franks\u2019s vehicle at an address listed for her and Ms. O\u2019Donovan less than two miles from the man\u2019s home. The \u201cvehicle was still warm to touch,\u201d an arrest affidavit said. The police said they found glitter inside the vehicle.", "Ms. Franks was seen walking around wearing the same clothes that the man told the police she was wearing when she broke into his apartment, according to an arrest affidavit.", "Ms. Franks and Ms. O\u2019Donovan were arrested and charged with felony burglary, and Ms. Franks was also charged with misdemeanor criminal mischief for kicking the window.", "The two women were booked into the Pinellas County Jail on Monday, and they were released on $75,000 bond each on Tuesday.", "Ms. Franks and Ms. O\u2019Donovan did not immediately respond to requests for comment on Wednesday. It was unclear whether they had lawyers.", "A motive was not immediately clear on Wednesday, nor was it clear if the women knew the victim. The Clearwater Police Department did not respond to requests for comment on Wednesday about a motive for the attack. The Pinellas County Sheriff\u2019s Office, which is assisting the Police Department, declined to comment, saying in an email on Wednesday afternoon that the attack was still under investigation.", "According to the arrest affidavits, there was no indication that Ms. Franks was under the influence of alcohol or drugs, though there were signs that Ms. O\u2019Donovan might have been drinking before the break-in."]
